features: Build two iconic WW2 army tanks with this kit - the German Tiger and the U.S. M4 Sherman, comes with an impressive 1184 blocks, ensuring a challenging yet enjoyable building experience.
Compatible with all major brands of building bricks sets, this kit offers endless creative possibilities for kids and adults aged 8 and up.
Each toy tank features stunning detail and comes complete with sandbags, guns, cannons, and other military weapons accessories for a more immersive building experience.
Enjoy a challenging and rewarding building experience with high-quality, durable pieces that will last for years to come.
Inspire your child's imagination and interest in history with this engaging and educational World War II army tank building toys, perfect for solo play or for building with friends and family.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: WW2 tank building set - the Tiger & the M4 Sherman Attention military buffs and building block enthusiasts - get ready to take on the World War II challenge with our latest offering, the Army Tank Building Kit. This set of building blocks comes with everything you need to build two of the most iconic tanks from that era - the German Tiger and the American M4 Sherman. Made with high-quality materials, this set includes a total of 1184 building blocks, which when assembled, will create a stunningly accurate replica of these famous tanks. Both tanks include an intricate design, complete with sandbags, guns, cannons, and other accessories that add an authentic touch to their final appearance.

Collect, build, display and fight! The great part about this building kit is that it is compatible with all major brands of building blocks, ensuring that kids can continue to use it to build whatever they can imagine while also expanding their existing collection of building blocks. If you're looking for a fun yet educational activity to keep your child entertained for hours, then the WWII Tank Building Kit is a must-have. The set's compatibility with other building block brands adds to its value as a timeless collection. It's a timeless gift that will keep on giving.

Authentic design and details The authentic design and details of each tank are a real standout feature of this kit. Each army tank features its own unique look, with intricate lines and curves that make it instantly recognizable. Side Back side Top

A rewarding experience for kids aged 8 and up This kit will provide hours of fun and educational activities for children aged 8 years and above. They can follow the step-by-step instructions, which are simple to understand, and put their problem-solving skills to the test to build a realistic replica of these tanks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Gave this to my fiancé as a gift. He was very excited and loved building it. Great for history nerds. I would say it’s more on the complicated side and not really meant for a younger audience unless with help. Pieces can be hard to connect. Over great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent little models!
reviews.reviewText: Based on previous reviews I ordered this set for my oldest child. It arrived timely, and was a lot of fun to put together. There was 1 missing piece, and that was resolved quickly! Great quality, the pieces hold together firm; they don't have a cheap feel many off-brand blocks have.Worth every penny.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grandson loved it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for my 9 year old grandson, who really loves tanks right now. He assembled both tanks without problems and loves displaying them now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Missing pieces but still viable
reviews.reviewText: On the Sherman, a few pieces were missing or misconfigured, and the instructions have a design issue with a couple of the steps. The Sherman could still be built without a major issue. The decals for the Sherman appear to be six point Jewish / Israeli stars. The Tiger came together as well. The package also comes with figures, a mounted gun, other guns, and sandbags for good measure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was my first mistbuy Lego set and I love it other than how if you put you finger on the front of the Sherman if comes off and it’s a pain to put back and and also please use ww2 firearms and not modern firearms

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Could be much better
reviews.reviewText: I'm 56 and have been playing with Legos since I was 5. I'm also an amateur World War 2 historian. I'm not expecting perfection but this kit has issues.Pros: pieces are well made and I had very few issues where I had to remove little left over plastic from the molds. Stickers were excellent. The Tiger tank is well designed and was easy to build. The only suggestion I have is going with 40 tread pieces instead of 41 on the Tiger. It's harder to put on but looks much better.Cons: Where to begin. Minor issues. Neither tanks have full bottom covers to them which is kind of silly and would cost little to include and design. There are no M16s, mini guns, or what looks like maybe an SR-25 during WW2.Major Issues. The M4 Sherman design is bad especially the front section which I included a picture of. Section 13 where the front area connects to is badly designed and needs to be redone. At least add a 4x2 plate to top of the hinge section to have it attach better. It will hang lower on the two 6x4 panels but improves the connection. It disconnects way too easy. The M4's barrel does not move up or down but the Tiger's barrel does??? I still can't figure out what the M4 hoses are supposed to be. And what are the brown tubes on the sides for??? Again not asking for perfection but it seems like someone added those as filler.The M4 Sherman's directions are also a mess. I would suggest swapping the following sections around:Sections 2 and 3Sections 5 and 6Sections 7 and 8The picture of the tank needs to be turned around in sections 11,12, and 19.Conclusion: If it was me, I would completely redesign the entire M4 Sherman tank from beginning to end including directions. It's that bad. Add plates to the bottom of both tanks.The Tiger tank is just great and I really like it. Sure I would make a couple of minor changes but overall it's great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty sick set
reviews.reviewText: I like the set, it’s very nice quality and once put together it looks very nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Poorly written instructions
reviews.reviewText: If you are use to the detailed instructions of Lego, then get ready for a headache with this. The pictures are very difficult to understand. My 10-year-old son has done very difficult builds with Legos, but this had him and I so frustrated. I would save her self time, frustration, money, and go with a different brand. Most likely will be returning it!
